page.title: 11LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: { {An interview with a Parish Councillor. A Parish Councillor is elected to look after the general welfare of the Parish. The main duties of a Parish Councillor are to look after footpaths and make sure that farmers don't plough them up. Stiles must be kept in good repair. If street lights are not working a warden is sent to mend them. They look out for potholes in the road, smelly drains, untidy gardens, garden bonfires and noisy neighbours. Any serious complaints are referred to the County Council. An important part of the job is to be available to the public and be prepared to follow up their complaints. The thing Dursley's people need most is a swimming pool and Cam need medical facilities.
